info.title: Specification for corectl
info.description: corectl contains various commands to interact with the Qlik Associative Engine. See respective command for more information

app.description: Name or identifier of the app

bash.description: Bash flag used to adapt output to bash completion format

certificates.description: path/to/folder containing client.pem, client_key.pem and root.pem certificates

config.description: path/to/config.yml where parameters can be set instead of on the command line

context.description: Name of the context used when connecting to Qlik Associative Engine

engine.description: URL to the Qlik Associative Engine

headers.description: Http headers to use when connecting to Qlik Associative Engine

insecure.description: Enabling insecure will make it possible to connect using self signed certificates

json.description: Returns output in JSON format if possible, disables verbose and traffic output

traffic.description: Log JSON websocket traffic to stdout

ttl.description: Qlik Associative Engine session time to live in seconds

import.description: Import the specified app into the engine, returns the ID of the created app

quiet.description: Only print IDs. Useful for scripting

ls.description: Print a list of all apps available in the current engine

quiet.description: Only print IDs. Useful for scripting

layout.description: Evaluate the layout of an generic bookmark

ls.description: Print a list of all generic bookmarks in the current app

properties.description: Print the properties of the generic bookmark

minimum.description: Only print properties required by engine

rm.description: Remove one or many bookmarks in the current app

set.description: Set or update the bookmarks in the current app

app-properties.description: Path to a json file containing the app properties

bookmarks.description: A list of generic bookmark json paths

connections.description: Path to a yml file containing the data connection definitions

dimensions.description: A list of generic dimension json paths

limit.description: Limit the number of rows to load

measures.description: A list of generic measures json paths

no-reload.description: Do not run the reload script

objects.description: A list of generic object json paths

script.description: Path to a qvs file containing the app data reload script

variables.description: A list of generic variable json paths

catwalk.description: Open the specified app in catwalk. If no app is specified the catwalk hub will be opened.

catwalk-url.description: Url to an instance of catwalk, if not provided the qlik one will be used

completion.description:
Generate a shell completion script for the specified shell (bash or zsh). The shell script must be evaluated to provide
interactive completion. This can be done by sourcing it in your ~/.bashrc or ~/.zshrc file.
Note that bash-completion is required and needs to be installed on your system.

get.description: Show the properties for a specific connection

ls.description: Print a list of all connections in the current app

quiet.description: Only print IDs. Useful for scripting

rm.description: Remove one or many connections from the app

set.description: Set or update the connections in the current app

context.description:
Create, update and use contexts

Contexts store connection information such as engine url, certificates and headers,
similar to a config. The main difference between contexts and configs is that they
can be used globally. Use the context subcommands to configure contexts which
facilitate app development in environments where certificates and headers are needed.

The current context is the one that is being used. You can use "context get" to
display the contents of the current context and switch context with "context set"
or unset the current context with "context unset".

Note that contexts have the lowest precedence. This means that e.g. an --engine flag
(or an engine field in a config) will override the engine url in the current context.

Contexts are stored locally in your ~/.corectl/contexts.yml file.

clear.description: Set the current context to none

get.description: Get context, current context by default

login.description:
Login and set cookie for the named context
	
This is only applicable when connecting to 'Qlik Sense Enterprise for Windows' through its proxy using HTTPS.
If no 'context-name' is used as argument the 'current-context' defined in the config will be used instead.

password.description: Password to be used when logging in to Qlik Sense Enterprise (use with caution)

user.description: Username to be used when logging in to Qlik Sense Enterprise

set.description:
Set a context to the current configuration

This command creates or updates a context by using the supplied flags and any
relevant config information found in the config file (if any).
The information stored will be engine url, headers and certificates (if present)
along with comment and the context-name.

layout.description: Evaluate the layout of an generic dimension

ls.description: Print a list of all generic dimensions in the current app

quiet.description: Only print IDs. Useful for scripting

properties.description: Print the properties of the generic dimension

minimum.description: Only print properties required by engine

rm.description: Remove one or many dimensions in the current app

set.description: Set or update the dimensions in the current app

eval.description: Evaluate a list of measures and dimensions. To evaluate a measure for a specific dimension use the <measure> by <dimension> notation. If dimensions are omitted then the eval will be evaluated over all dimensions.

fields.description: Print all the fields in an app, and for each field also some sample content, tags and and number of values

quiet.description: Only print IDs. Useful for scripting

generate-docs.description: Generate markdown docs based on cobra commands

generate-spec.description: Generate API spec docs based on cobra commands

help.description:
Help provides help for any command in the application.
Simply type corectl help [path to command] for full details.

keys.description: Print a fields list containing key-only fields

layout.description: Evaluate the layout of an generic measure and prints in JSON format

ls.description: Print a list of all generic measures in the current app

quiet.description: Only print IDs. Useful for scripting

properties.description: Print the properties of the generic measure

minimum.description: Only print properties required by engine

rm.description: Remove one or many generic measures in the current app

set.description: Set or update the measures in the current app

meta.description: Print tables, fields, associations along with metadata like memory consumption, field cardinality etc

data.description: Evaluate the hypercube data of a generic object

layout.description: Evaluate the hypercube layout of the generic object

ls.description: Print a list of all generic objects in the current app

quiet.description: Only print IDs. Useful for scripting

properties.description: Print the properties of the generic object in JSON format

full.description: Using 'GetFullPropertyTree' to retrieve properties for children as well

minimum.description: Only print properties required by engine

rm.description: Remove one or many generic objects in the current app

set.description:
Set or update the objects in the current app.
The JSON objects can be in either the GenericObjectProperties format or the GenericObjectEntry format

limit.description: Limit the number of rows to load

get.description: Print the reload script currently set in the app

set.description: Set the script in the current app

add.description: Add an alternate states in the current app

ls.description: Print a list of all alternate states in the current app

quiet.description: Only print IDs. Useful for scripting

rm.description: Removes an alternate state in the current app

status.description: Print status info about the connection to the engine and current app, and also the status of the data model

tables.description: Print tables for the data model in an app

unbuild.description:
Extracts generic objects, dimensions, measures, variables, reload script and connections from an app in an engine into separate json and yaml files.
In addition to the resources from the app a corectl.yml configuration file is generated that binds them all together.
Passwords in the connection definitions can not be exported from the app and hence need to be handled manually.
Generic Object trees (e.g. Qlik Sense sheets) are exported as a full property tree which means that child objects are found inside the parentÂ´s json (the qChildren array).

dir.description: Path to a the folder where the unbuilt app is exported

values.description: Print the top values for a specific field in your data model

layout.description: Evaluate the layout of an generic variable

ls.description: Print a list of all generic variables in the current app

quiet.description: Only print IDs. Useful for scripting

properties.description: Print the properties of the generic variable

minimum.description: Only print properties required by engine

rm.description: Remove one or many variables in the current app

set.description: Set or update the variables in the current app
